Implicit Racism

This test was designed to test implicit racism. Most people believe that they are not biased towards any race, which also shows through the way they act: They never say bad things about people based on their race and do not overgeneralise. However, even these people still might implicitly associate more good things with people from their own race and bad things with other races. This is called implicit racism. The same principle can be applied to other prejudices as well, like sexism or homophobia.

How does it work?

We measure the difference in time you take to respond in each set of questions. The difference between the time taken for you to respond between the two sections makes your score. Then with some tech wizardry (statistics) we work out how subconsciously racist/sexist you are!

How do I take the test?

You take the test by associating words/images to the right category. For instance, there might be a 'good' and a 'bad' category to which you would assign the words 'pleasure' and 'pain' respectively. You will also have to assign words/images to shared categories. For instance, there might be a 'white AND bad' category to which you would assign images containing caucasians and words like 'pleasure', and another category containing the opposites of this category. When you assign something to the wrong category, you will be notified by the presentation of a red cross. Then you will have to assign the word/image to the other category (be fast!).

Good Luck!

What does my score mean, am I really a racist?\n\nWell yes and no. The test uses implicit association to work out if you associate one group of people over another in a favourable way. However, it is entirely subconscious. This means that while you may say and believe you are not a racist, you may find it easier to associate one group with good words and another group with bad words. This is often due to cultural and media influences. The most important thing is to be conscious about the way you think and talk about people from a different race/ethnicity/sex etc. The test is not designed to accuse anyone, but merely to increase consciousness in a fun way.
